title: inputData
description: A versatile chart widget for visualizing data as line charts, bar charts, or scatter plots. Use this widget for time-series data, trend analysis, comparisons, and general data visualization. Supports multiple data series with different chart types in the same view, automatic pivot-based series generation, zoom controls, and flexible styling options. The ECharts-based rendering provides smooth animations and interactive tooltips. Ideal for monitoring dashboards, historical data analysis, and any scenario requiring visual data representation over continuous or categorical dimensions.

title.title: Title
title.description: The main heading displayed above the chart. Use to describe what data is being visualized (e.g., 'Temperature Over Time', 'Sales by Region').

subTitle.title: Subtitle
subTitle.description: Secondary text displayed below the title. Use for additional context like data source, time period, or measurement units.

axis.title: Configuration
axis.description: Chart display settings including axes, legend, and layout options.

xAxisLabel.title: X-Axis Label
xAxisLabel.description: Label text displayed below the horizontal axis. Describes the x-dimension (e.g., 'Time', 'Date', 'Category').

yAxisLabel.title: Y-Axis Label
yAxisLabel.description: Label text displayed beside the vertical axis. Describes the measured values (e.g., 'Temperature (Â°C)', 'Count', 'Revenue ($)').

showLegend.title: Show Legend
showLegend.description: When enabled, displays a legend identifying each data series by color and label. Essential for multi-series charts.

showTitle.title: Show Title
showTitle.description: When enabled, displays the chart title and subtitle. Disable for compact layouts or when the widget container provides its own title.

showBox.title: Show Box Frame
showBox.description: When enabled, draws a border frame around the chart plotting area. Useful for visual separation in dense dashboards.

timeseries.title: Timeseries Chart
timeseries.description: When enabled, treats x-axis values as timestamps and applies proper time-based scaling and formatting. Enable when your x-values are dates/times (ISO strings or timestamps). Disable for categorical x-axes.

columnLayout.title: Vertical Layout
columnLayout.description: When multiple charts are drawn (via chartName grouping), this controls their arrangement. Enabled = stacked vertically, Disabled = arranged horizontally side by side.

showXAxis.title: Show X-Axis
showXAxis.description: When enabled, displays the x-axis line, ticks, and labels. Disable to remove bottom axis and its padding for minimal designs.

xAxisZoom.title: X-Axis Zoom Tool
xAxisZoom.description: When enabled, shows a slider control below the chart for zooming into specific x-axis ranges. Useful for long time series where users need to focus on specific periods.

showYAxis.title: Show Y-Axis
showYAxis.description: When enabled, displays the y-axis line, ticks, and labels. Disable to remove left axis and its padding for minimal designs.

yAxisScaling.title: Y-Axis Scaling
yAxisScaling.description: When enabled, the y-axis range automatically adjusts to fit the data (min to max). When disabled, the y-axis always starts at 0, which is better for comparing absolute values.

dataseries.title: Dataseries
dataseries.description: Array of data series to plot. Each series can have its own chart type (line/bar/scatter), colors, and styling. Multiple series can share an axis or be grouped into separate charts.

label.title: Label
label.description: Display name for this data series shown in legends and tooltips. Should clearly identify what data this series represents.

type.title: Drawing Style
type.description: The visual representation type: 'line' for continuous line charts (best for trends), 'bar' for vertical bar charts (best for comparisons), 'scatter' for individual data points (best for correlation analysis).

backgroundColor.title: Fill Color
backgroundColor.description: For bar charts: the bar fill color. For line charts: the data point marker fill color. For scatter: the point fill color. Leave empty to use theme default.

borderColor.title: Line Color
borderColor.description: For line charts: the line stroke color. For bar charts: the bar border color. This is the primary color identifying the series.

styling.title: Styling
styling.description: Additional visual styling options for the series.

fill.title: Line Area Fill
fill.description: When enabled for line charts, fills the area between the line and the x-axis, creating an area chart. Useful for visualizing volume or cumulative values.

borderWidth.title: Line Width
borderWidth.description: Thickness of lines in pixels. Larger values make lines more prominent. Typical values: 1-2 for dense charts, 2-4 for emphasis.

borderDash.title: Line Dash Style
borderDash.description: Line pattern for line charts: 'solid' for continuous lines, 'dashed' for long dashes, 'dotted' for dots. Use different patterns to distinguish overlapping series.

pointStyle.title: Symbol Style
pointStyle.description: Shape of data point markers: 'circle', 'rect' (square), 'roundRect', 'triangle', 'diamond', 'pin', 'arrow', or 'none' to hide markers. Different shapes help distinguish series.

advanced.title: Advanced Settings
advanced.description: Advanced configuration for multi-chart layouts and draw ordering.

drawOrder.title: Draw Order
drawOrder.description: Z-index controlling which series appears on top when overlapping. Lower numbers are drawn on top. Use to ensure important series aren't hidden behind others.

chartName.title: Chart Name
chartName.description: Groups series into separate charts. Series with the same chartName share one chart; different names create separate charts. Use '#split#' in the name to auto-create one chart per pivot value.

data.title: Data
data.description: Array of data points to plot. Each point has x (position on horizontal axis), y (value), and optionally r (point size) and pivot (for auto-generating series).

x.title: X-Value
x.description: The horizontal axis value. For timeseries charts, use ISO 8601 timestamp strings (e.g., '2023-11-04T22:47:52.351152+00:00') or Unix timestamps. For categorical charts, use category labels.

y.title: Y-Value
y.description: The vertical axis value representing the measurement or count at this x position.

r.title: Point Size
r.description: Radius/size of the data point marker for line and scatter charts. Use varying sizes to encode a third data dimension (bubble chart effect).

pivot.title: Split Data by
pivot.description: Column value used to split this data into multiple series automatically. Each unique pivot value creates a separate line/bar series (e.g., pivot by 'city' to get one line per city).
